Loafy is a desktop app for keeping track of all the things you need to do.
From simple todos to important event dates,
you never have to search anywhere else for your task lists again.

- date: `DAY OF WEEK[ HHmm]` or `d/M/yyyy[ HHmm]`
(the date will be read as this coming tuesday 2359)

Loafy data are saved in the hard disk automatically after any command that changes the data.
The data will reload automatically the next time you open the program on the same desktop.
There is no need to save manually.
* Represents a command to add the task to a task list.
* Each instance of AddCommand is tied to an instance of Task.
* Constructs an add command for the specified task.
* @param task The task to be added.
* Adds the task in this command to the end of the specified task list.
* Returns a message to confirm the addition of the task.
* @param tasks Task list to which the task will be added to.
* @return The message to confirm the addition of the task.
public String execute(TaskList tasks, Ui ui) {
public abstract String execute(TaskList tasks, Ui ui);
* Represents a command to delete the task with the specified task id from a task list.
* Constructs a delete command for the specified task id.
* @param taskId Task id of the task to be deleted.
* Deletes the task with the task id in this command from the specified task list.
* Returns a message to confirm the deletion of the task.
* If the task id is invalid, an error message is returned to inform the user.
* @param tasks Task list from which the task will be deleted from.
* @param ui User interface which will format the error message.
* @return The message to be viewed by the user.
public String execute(TaskList tasks, Ui ui) {
* Represents a command to terminate the Loafy program.
* @param tasks Task list used in the program.
* @param ui User interface which will generate the exit message.
public String execute(TaskList tasks, Ui ui) {
* Represents a command to find a task by its name in the task list.
* Constructs a find command for the specified keyword.
* @param keyword the keyword to be used to find the task.
* Finds the task which name contains the keyword from the specified task list.
* Returns a display of all tasks containing the keyword with their id in the list.
* If no matches are found, an error message is returned to inform the user.
* @param tasks Task list from which the task will be found.
* @return the message to be viewed by the user.
public String execute(TaskList tasks, Ui ui) {

* Returns a Loafy Exception for wrong order of '/from' and '/to' command.

* Represents a task with a specified deadline.
* Constructs an undone deadline task with the specified name and deadline.
* @param name The name of the deadline task.
* @param date The deadline of the task of type {@code LocalDateTime}.
* Constructs a deadline task with the specified status (done or undone), name and deadline.
* @param isDone The state of the task ({@code true} for done and {@code false} for undone).
* @param name The name of the deadline task.
* @param date The deadline of the task of type {@code LocalDateTime}.
public Deadline(boolean isDone, String name, LocalDateTime date) {
* Returns a string representation of this deadline task for user view.
* The string representation is in the format "[D][status] name (by: date)",
* status is represented by "X" if task is done and " " if task is undone;
* and date is in the format "d/M/yyyy HHmm".
* @return a string representation of this deadline task.
* Returns a string representation of this deadline task for data storing.
* The string representation is in the format "type,status,name,deadline", where:
* status = "true" if task is done and "false" if task is not done;
* name is exactly the name of the task;
* @return a string representation of this deadline task.
* Represents an event task with specified start and end date and time.

* @param startDate The start date and time of the event of type {@code LocalDateTime}.
* @param endDate The end date and time of the event of type {@code LocalDateTime}.
